title: List of church restorations and alterations by Anthony Salvin
data: Ashcombe , Devon 50°36′20″N 3°32′19″W / 50.6056°N 3.5386°W / 50.6056 ; -3.5386 ( St Nectan 's Church , Ashcombe )
Restoration of a church dating from the 13th century
Helmingham , Suffolk 52°10′24″N 1°12′09″E / 52.1734°N 1.2025°E / 52.1734 ; 1.2025 ( St Mary 's Church , Helmingham )
Restoration and partial rebuilding of a church dating from the 12th century
Arncliffe , North Yorkshire 54°08′37″N 2°06′14″W / 54.1437°N 2.1039°W / 54.1437 ; -2.1039 ( St Oswald 's Church , Arncliffe )
Restoration of the nave in 1841 , and rebuilding of the chancel in 1843

Greystoke , Cumbria 54°40′09″N 2°51′52″W / 54.6691°N 2.8645°W / 54.6691 ; -2.8645 ( St Andrew 's Church , Greystoke )
Restoration of a church dating from the 13th century
Castle Rising , Norfolk 52°47′45″N 0°28′12″E / 52.7957°N 0.4701°E / 52.7957 ; 0.4701 ( St Lawrence 's Church , Castle Rising )
Restoration of a church dating from the 12th century
Lower Peover , Cheshire 53°15′50″N 2°23′11″W / 53.2639°N 2.3864°W / 53.2639 ; -2.3864 ( St Oswald 's Church , Lower Peover )
Aldridge , West Midlands 52°36′16″N 1°54′45″W / 52.6044°N 1.9126°W / 52.6044 ; -1.9126 ( St Mary 's Church , Aldridge )
Extensive restoration of a church dating from the 14th century , with rebuilding of the north aisle and chancel
St Philip and St James ' Church
Rock , Northumberland 55°28′32″N 1°40′54″W / 55.4755°N 1.6817°W / 55.4755 ; -1.6817 ( St Philip and St James ' Church , Rock )
Restoration and rebuilding of a church dating from the 12th century , with a new bellcote , vestry and apse
Weaverham , Cheshire 53°15′50″N 2°34′33″W / 53.2638°N 2.5758°W / 53.2638 ; -2.5758 ( St Mary 's Church , Weaverham )
Restoration of a church dating from the 15th century
Flixton , Suffolk 52°25′45″N 1°23′58″E / 52.4293°N 1.3995°E / 52.4293 ; 1.3995 ( St Mary 's Church , Flixton )
Church of St Mary the Great
Cambridge 52°12′19″N 0°07′06″E / 52.2053°N 0.1183°E / 52.2053 ; 0.1183 ( Church of St Mary the Great , Cambridge )
Restoration of a church dating from the 14th century
Sherburn-in-Elmet , North Yorkshire 53°47′45″N 1°15′38″W / 53.7958°N 1.2606°W / 53.7958 ; -1.2606 ( All Saints Church , Sherburn-in-Elmet )
Fernhurst , West Sussex 51°02′56″N 0°43′08″W / 51.0489°N 0.7190°W / 51.0489 ; -0.7190 ( St Margaret 's Church , Fernhurst )
Restoration and rebuilding of a church dating from the 12th century . The 1881 work was one of Salvin 's last commissions
Whickham , Tyne and Wear 54°56′47″N 1°40′27″W / 54.9464°N 1.6741°W / 54.9464 ; -1.6741 ( St Mary 's Church , Whickham )
Restoration of a church dating from the 12th century , with the addition of a second north aisle , vestry , organ chamber , and a new roof
St Mary and St Michael 's Church
Alnwick , Northumberland 55°25′01″N 1°42′40″W / 55.4169°N 1.7112°W / 55.4169 ; -1.7112 ( St Mary and St Michael 's Church , Alnwick )
Restoration of a church dating mainly from the 15th century
intro: Anthony Salvin (1799-1881) was an English architect, born in Sunderland Bridge, County Durham. He trained under John Paterson of Edinburgh, and moved to London in 1821. His works include new churches, restoration of and additions to existing churches, and various other buildings, including schools. However, he is mainly noted for his work on existing major buildings, including castles, and for designing new substantial country houses. The castles on which he worked include Windsor Castle, Norwich Castle, Rockingham Castle, Newark Castle, Warkworth Castle, Muncaster Castle, and Warwick Castle. He also carried out work on the Tower of London, and on Trinity College, Cambridge, Gonville and Caius College, Cambridge, and University College, Durham. His new country houses include Mamhead House (his first major project), Scotney Castle, Keele Hall, Thoresby Hall, and Peckforton Castle. In addition he designed the Observatory for Durham University. Thus list contains details of churches with restorations, additions and alterations by Salvin.
